understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is a method that returns an IAuditLogger based on the provided ParameterizedClass logger. It checks if the logger class_name is not null and creates a new AuditLogger based on the class_name and parameters. If the class_name is null, it defaults to creating a new AuditLogger of type BinAuditLogger.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code is related to configuring the Audit logging options by providing a way to get the appropriate AuditLogger based on the logger class_name provided. This code is part of the larger configuration setup for enabling and managing Audit logging in the system.

config_description: Audit logging - Logs every incoming CQL command request, authentication to a node. See the docs on audit_logging for full details about the various configuration options.
developer_understanding_on_working: The audit_logging_options configuration is used to enable or disable audit logging in the system. When enabled, it logs every incoming CQL command request and authentication to a node. The configuration options include specifying the logger, included/excluded keyspaces, categories, and users, as well as an archive command.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The audit_logging_options configuration is triggered when the system initializes and when the enableAuditLog method is called with the necessary parameters to enable audit logging.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: Enabling audit logging can have an impact on system performance and resource usage, especially when logging a large number of requests. It can increase the size of log files and potentially impact system responsiveness. Careful consideration should be given to the configuration options to balance the need for audit logging with system performance.
